metadata.synopsis: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: I greet you, child of the stars. How has your search for the mushrooms fared?
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

46.speaker: Omeluum
46.text: I greet you, child of the sun. How has your search for the mushrooms fared?
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

136.speaker: Omeluum
136.text: I greet you, friend of the dark.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

139.speaker: Omeluum
139.text: Greetings. What knowledge do you seek?
139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

155.speaker: Omeluum
155.text: I greet you, child of the stars.
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

204.speaker: Omeluum
204.text: You return. Have you changed your mind about the ring?
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

234.speaker: Omeluum
234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: How did you escape your colony?
273.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

64.speaker: Omeluum
64.text: I was born with a propensity for arcane magic my people despise. It gave me the strength to resist the elder brain.

138.speaker: Omeluum
138.text: Every waking hour, I pushed back against its dire hold. My wizardry empowered me.

197.speaker: Omeluum
197.text: The moment its control shattered, I fled before the colony discovered I had defected.

145.speaker: Omeluum
145.text: Are you so keen to know my pain, young gith?

39.speaker: Omeluum
39.text: That is not a story I share with strangers.

268.speaker: Player
268.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?
268.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

6.speaker: Omeluum
6.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

166.speaker: Omeluum
166.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

160.speaker: Omeluum
160.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

89.speaker: Omeluum
89.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

19.speaker: Omeluum
19.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

15.speaker: Omeluum
15.text: I cannot change my appetites. Although I am experimenting in reducing them with magic.

184.speaker: Omeluum
184.text: Perhaps with time, it can be one brain a year instead of one a month...

235.speaker: Player
235.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.
235.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

247.speaker: Omeluum
247.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: Swallow your disgust and permit the ghaik's search.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Relax and allow Omeluum's mind to search yours.

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *As Omeluum's mind pierces yours, the tadpole pulses with power.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *It feels ten times its size. Alive, awake. Almost smug.*

98.speaker: Omeluum
98.text: This is most unusual. The incubation period should be complete, as should your transformation.

103.speaker: Omeluum
103.text: But the larva is infused with strange magic. It appears to be in some form of stasis.

294.speaker: Omeluum
294.text: No. It appears to be shielded from physical and magical influence.

296.speaker: Omeluum
296.text: And even without the shield, the extraction would involve severe cranial trauma.

144.speaker: Omeluum
144.text: It is not ideal. The process would surely kill you.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Don't waste my time. Say what you mean.

124.speaker: Blurg
124.text: Ahem. Death. It means you would have to die first to extract the tadpole.

27.speaker: Omeluum
27.text: Extracting the larva would kill you. Immediately.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Tell Omeluum about the strange mind flayer ship you were on.

135.speaker: Omeluum
135.text: A nautiloid? Fascinating. I have never set foot on one myself.

218.speaker: Omeluum
218.text: They were our warships during the greatest eras of the Illithid Empire. We ruled the entire Astral Plane from their decks.

303.speaker: Omeluum
303.text: The design was lost when the gith rebelled and ended our dominion.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: What happens if that stasis goes away?

291.speaker: Omeluum
291.text: I can only theorise, but I suspect your transformation would be both agonising and instantaneous.

287.speaker: Blurg
287.text: I thought it was always agonising, Omeluum.

289.speaker: Omeluum
289.text: Well, yes, but that wasn't my point.

115.speaker: Omeluum
115.text: Of course. I am sorry I cannot assist you in its removal.

126.speaker: Blurg
126.text: Oh? Perhaps I should start taking notes.

74.speaker: Omeluum
74.text: There may be a way to bypass that stasis. There are many alchemical substances that can influence the mind.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Bypass? What kind of alchemy are we talking about?

248.speaker: Omeluum
248.text: A tincture distilled from a collection of rare mushrooms. They have subtle psionic influence.

109.speaker: Omeluum
109.text: I would require a fresh tongue of madness and timmask spores.

203.speaker: Omeluum
203.text: But be warned. In their natural state, both of these mushrooms can be quite dangerous.

305.speaker: Omeluum
305.text: Timmasks cause confusion in those that approach them. The tongue is... self-explanatory.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Eating those doesn't sound like a great idea.

97.speaker: Omeluum
97.text: My formula will hamper the more harmful effects once the mushrooms are brewed into a potion.

215.speaker: Omeluum
215.text: Your sanity, however much you possess, should remain intact.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Lovely. So where do I find these mushrooms?

168.speaker: Blurg
168.text: The Underdark, of course. Although they are quite rare, and their discovery... perilous.

288.speaker: Blurg
288.text: Hm. I imagine Lenore would have them in her possession. She served Mystra as a cleric.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: Why would a cleric have a bunch of dangerous mushrooms?

206.speaker: Blurg
206.text: She is quite fond of her garden. Lenore has always been a lonely sort - nature was her only companion.

150.speaker: Blurg
150.text: I offered her the chance to join the Society, but she refused. Her experiments on sussur bark took priority.

240.speaker: Blurg
240.text: The southwest, when I last saw her. Although her tower does have a tendency... to move.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: Good to know. I have other priorities right now.

282.speaker: Omeluum
282.text: May your travels be safe and swift.

283.speaker: Omeluum
283.text: In nature, of course. But I imagine the nearby cleric's tower may also grow them.

266.speaker: Omeluum
266.text: The occupant was obsessed with magical plants. Sussur bark and the like. But no matter their source, I will take the mushrooms.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: That's too risky of an experiment for me. Count me out.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: All right. I'll come back when I find the mushrooms.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I think I already have what you're looking for.

312.speaker: Player
312.text: Isn't the stasis why the tadpole hasn't killed me yet?

40.speaker: Omeluum
40.text: I do not intend to shatter its protection.

93.speaker: Omeluum
93.text: I need only bypass the interference that prevents me from communicating with the larva.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: No, I'm done with all this.

34.speaker: Omeluum
34.text: Understandable. If you change your mind in the future, say as such. I will perform the experiment then.

297.speaker: Player
297.text: All that probing was useless in the end.

209.speaker: Omeluum
209.text: My apologies. I hope the experience was not too unpleasant.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Bashing my skull is just part of a day's work.

233.speaker: Omeluum
233.text: You would not survive the outcome. The tadpole must be completely crushed, and your skull along with it.

308.speaker: Player
308.text: How severe? I have healing magic.

32.speaker: Omeluum
32.text: I intend no disrespect, but one can only heal so much of their own brain tissue.

35.speaker: Omeluum
35.text: But not to worry. Should you transform, I will happily perform a new examination.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: My mind is all addled, can you tell why?

56.speaker: Omeluum
56.text: The larva is not the only creature that has been inside this brain. But at present it is the sole resident.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Oh Gods, what do you mean?

244.speaker: Omeluum
244.text: Your flesh has been burrowed into. Your flesh has been excavated. A tadpole need not tunnel when they greet their host.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Damn it all, why can't I remember?

110.speaker: Omeluum
110.text: It seems as if someone did not want you to.

307.speaker: Omeluum
307.text: Unfortunately, beyond the assessment of my own kind, I cannot speculate what has passed through your cerebrum.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

198.speaker: Omeluum
198.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I changed my mind. What do you need to experiment on the tadpole?
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Refresh my memory - what do you need for the potion?
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

78.speaker: Omeluum
78.text: A tongue of madness and the spores from a timmask mushroom.

201.speaker: Omeluum
201.text: You may find them in nature, or the nearby cleric's tower. Be cautious - those that have taken root are quite dangerous.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I found those mushrooms you were looking for.
194.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

112.speaker: Omeluum
112.text: These are fine specimens. It will only take me a moment to brew them to proper potency.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Take a look at those mushrooms yet?
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

313.speaker: Narrator
313.text: *Omeluum turns away to prepare the potion, lost in its own musings.*
313.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

134.speaker: Omeluum
134.text: You must drink the entire draught. I can make no promises as to its taste.
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Omeluum turns to face the player, offering them a potion bottle.

25.speaker: Player
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: *The potion is disgusting beyond description. The only mercy is that it goes down quickly.*
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust.

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *The potion is disgusting beyond description. The only mercy is that it goes down quickly.*
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust.

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *The potion is disgusting beyond description. The only mercy is that it goes down quickly.*
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust.

178.speaker: Omeluum
178.text: Not a drop left. Very good.
178.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

211.speaker: Omeluum
211.text: As the potion influences your mind, you may find yourself acting irrationally. Try and stay focused.
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

186.text: *The world loses its edges, its finer boundaries. You are fluid but trapped, like a creature suspended in amber.*
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *The world loses its edges, its finer boundaries. You are fluid but trapped, like a creature suspended in amber.*
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: Use meditation to clear your mind.
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

252.text: *Drawing on a lifetime of practice, you centre yourself. Your body is an anchor, implacable and calm.*
252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

277.speaker: Narrator
277.text: *Drawing on a lifetime of practice, you centre yourself. Your body is an anchor, implacable and calm.*
277.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes their eyes, physically relaxing.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: Draw on your willpower and resist.
281.context: CinematicNodeContext: Darkness FX pushes in from the edge of the screen.

279.speaker: Narrator
279.text: *Dark holes bite at the edges of your vision, but the void cannot draw you in.*
279.context: CinematicNodeContext: Darkness FX pushes in from the edge of the screen.

185.speaker: Narrator
185.text: *Dark holes bite at the edges of your vision, but the void cannot draw you in.*
185.context: CinematicNodeContext: Darkness FX pushes in from the edge of the screen.

286.text: *You're sinking - sinking into a starless void that has no end. The connection between mind and body draws thin and tight.*
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character's eyes go wide, staring off into nothing.

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *You're sinking - sinking into a starless void that has no end. The connection between mind and body draws thin and tight.*
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character's eyes go wide, staring off into nothing.

306.speaker: Player
306.text: Focus on the present, not the illusions.
306.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small colorful FX on the screen.

105.text: *A few sparks and colours dance around Omeluum, but you stay steady and staring ahead.*
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small colorful FX on the screen.

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *A few sparks and colours dance around Omeluum, but you stay steady and staring ahead.*
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small colorful FX on the screen.

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *The tadpole spasms, seizes. It's fighting the potion even harder than you are.*
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs their head in agony, tadpole halo FX/effect in place.

293.speaker: Narrator
293.text: *Fear pierces your mind like knives of ice. The parasite digs deeper, as if it means to hollow out your skull.*
293.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs their head in agony, tadpole halo FX/effect in place.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Call to your god for protection.
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

171.speaker: Player
171.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Drown out the tadpole by focusing on a tune.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

242.speaker: Player
242.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Wall off your mind from the psionic seizure.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

177.speaker: Narrator
177.text: *The cold blades lose their edge. You are stalwart, turning that tide of fear against itself.*
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

214.speaker: Narrator
214.text: *The cold blades lose their edge. You are stalwart, turning that tide of fear against itself.*
214.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player relaxes. Tadpole halo/FX in place.

142.speaker: Narrator
142.text: *The parasite swells with power - more power than you have ever felt before.*

262.speaker: Narrator
262.text: *It surges and twists, lashing out against that which would dare to intrude.*
262.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on Omeluum. The glowing effect lashes out at it.

285.speaker: Omeluum
285.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

249.speaker: Narrator
249.text: *The parasite in your mind quiets, pleased with itself.*
249.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

175.speaker: Blurg
175.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

190.speaker: Omeluum
190.text: That larva is like nothing I have ever observed before. Its power is... unsettling.
190.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I felt it grow inside me. There's more power than ever.
41.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

137.speaker: Omeluum
137.text: Such an outcome was not in my calculations. There is more to this being than mere stasis.
137.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: So I went through all this and the tadpole's still lodged in my brain?
237.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

54.speaker: Omeluum
54.text: Indeed. Although I may have another solution, albeit a temporary one.
54.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

170.speaker: Omeluum
170.text: I possess a Ring of Mind-Shielding. It prevents elder brains from noticing my presence.
170.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

153.speaker: Omeluum
153.text: It will not remove the larva, but it will limit its influence, both positive and negative.
153.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

213.speaker: Omeluum
213.text: I would offer it as a gift, but in truth, the ring is priceless. Is there anything you could offer me in turn?
213.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Why didn't you mention the ring before this potion debacle?
157.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

30.speaker: Omeluum
30.text: Because removal seemed preferable to negation.

299.speaker: Omeluum
299.text: And I must admit, I was curious to study the tadpole myself.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I have gold. Will that suit?
140.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

121.speaker: Omeluum
121.text: My research is in perpetual need of funding. Yes, I am willing to accept your coin.
121.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

270.speaker: Omeluum
270.text: If you wish to acquire the ring later, you need only ask.
270.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

258.speaker: Omeluum
258.text: If you wish to acquire the ring later, you need only ask.
258.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

300.speaker: Omeluum
300.text: May it serve you as well as it has served me.
300.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: To deal with this abomination? Nigh unthinkable. Yet even Vlaakith herself could not deny the ring's merit.
23.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: To deal with this abomination? Nigh unthinkable. Yet even Vlaakith herself could not deny the ring's merit.
75.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: That thing better work. If it doesn't, I doubt you'll be in any position to complain...
219.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: 'I hope that was a good bargain you just made' - player just acquired a ring with magical properties.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: Nice. Helps not to judge a book by its cover, doesn't it.
66.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Of course, the larva remains. Be ever-vigilant of its growth.

87.speaker: Omeluum
87.text: Of course, the larva remains. Be ever-vigilant of its growth.

292.speaker: Astarion
292.text: A pretty thing. And at least it offers us some protection from the tadpole.
292.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: stress on 'some' - you'd prefer more protection.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: I never thought we'd bargain with an illithid. Let's hope this ring proves invaluable.
133.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.

224.speaker: Gale
224.text: That could mean any number of things.
224.context: InternalNodeContext: Reaction on player acquiring the ring. Might be from persuasion or from buying it from Omeluum.NodeContext: Suspicious of the mind flayer's words.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: No, I want this power. Keep your ring.

217.speaker: Omeluum
217.text: A bold strategy. It is not many that can defeat their own minds.

50.speaker: Omeluum
50.text: If you require it on another occasion, merely ask.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: How about I tell you more about that nautiloid? Every last detail.

62.speaker: Omeluum
62.text: A fascinating topic indeed. What can you tell me?

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Give a dramatic retelling of your time on the mind flayer ship.

228.speaker: Omeluum
228.text: What a brilliant experience. To feel one step closer to my ancestors is a fine gift indeed.

275.speaker: Omeluum
275.text: What a brilliant experience. To feel one step closer to my ancestors is a fine gift indeed.

195.text: Hm. I am afraid you have not offered any information I do not already possess.

86.speaker: Omeluum
86.text: Hm. I am afraid you have not offered any information I do not already possess.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Offer a detailed, logical analysis of the nautiloid.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Enrich your story with details from the designs you found on the nautiloid.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: Never mind. I'm not in the mood for sharing.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I've flown on a mind flayer ship. I can trade you details of the schematics, if you're interested.

239.speaker: Omeluum
239.text: A nautiloid? Fascinating. I have never set foot on one myself.

108.speaker: Omeluum
108.text: They were our warships during the greatest eras of the Illithid Empire. We ruled the entire Astral Plane from their decks.

148.speaker: Omeluum
148.text: The design was lost when the gith rebelled and ended our dominion.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Your people enslaved mine. The debt is yours to repay.

70.text: I enslaved no one, and stand against such practice. I cannot surrender my own shield for nothing.

52.speaker: Omeluum
52.text: I enslaved no one, and stand against such practice. I cannot surrender my own shield for nothing.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I wouldn't be in this situation if it wasn't for a mind flayer. You owe me.

223.speaker: Omeluum
223.text: That... is true. And I cannot imagine many other mind flayers will offer restitution.

302.speaker: Omeluum
302.text: That... is true. And I cannot imagine many other mind flayers will offer restitution.

102.speaker: Omeluum
102.text: Except... it does not seem to be on my person. Did I leave it on that last expedition somewhere? Hm.

116.speaker: Omeluum
116.text: My apologies. I cannot trade what I do not possess.

187.text: Your conflict is with one I have never met. This ring protects me. I cannot surrender it for free.

280.speaker: Omeluum
280.text: Your conflict is with one I have never met. This ring protects me. I cannot surrender it for free.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Something of little value - your life.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: Either give me the ring, or I'll run you through.

96.speaker: Omeluum
96.text: We shouldn't cause trouble, Omeluum. There are enough threats down here in the Underdark.

141.speaker: Blurg
141.text: We shouldn't cause trouble, Omeluum. There are enough threats down here in the Underdark.

232.speaker: Omeluum
232.text: Very well. I abhor violence, and would rather prevent it where possible.

182.text: I understand the potion has put you in a... precarious condition. But I will not respond to such threats.

132.speaker: Omeluum
132.text: I understand the potion has put you in a... precarious condition. But I will not respond to such threats.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Perform the tale of your adventures so far: 'The Ballad of Brains, Brine Pools and Balderdash.'

260.text: *As Omeluum watches your performance, something stirs in his mind, unusual for an illithid: joy.*

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *As Omeluum watches your performance, something stirs in his mind, unusual for an illithid: joy.*

11.speaker: Player
11.text: What's next? Cutting off my own head?

91.speaker: Omeluum
91.text: Such crude destruction may not waylay a larva like this. But there is another possibility.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I suppose it's not all bad. More power is better than less.

272.speaker: Omeluum
272.text: Yet that power may grow beyond your control. I have another intermediate solution, if you are in need.

290.speaker: Player
290.text: That potion of yours could have killed me. The tadpole almost did the same.

216.speaker: Omeluum
216.text: It holds far more power than it should. For the larva to react to my manipulations in such a way is beyond my ken.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: You were supposed to make it weaker, not stronger!

163.speaker: Omeluum
163.text: You have my deepest apologies. The larva did not care for my intentions.

130.text: *A wave of psychic force batters your mind, cruel and calculating. You are nothing to it. You are small.*
130.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player buckles in pain. Tadpole halo FX/effect.

220.speaker: Narrator
220.text: *A wave of psychic force batters your mind, cruel and calculating. You are nothing to it. You are small.*
220.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player buckles in pain. Tadpole halo FX/effect.

14.text: *The acidic liquid tightens your throat, burning on the way down. It's a bolt of agony straight to your stomach.*
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust, looking pained.

254.speaker: Narrator
254.text: *The acidic liquid tightens your throat, burning on the way down. It's a bolt of agony straight to your stomach.*
254.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character winces and flinches in disgust, looking pained.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: What exactly is this going to do to me?

255.speaker: Omeluum
255.text: It will lower the psionic defences around the larva. If I cannot remove it, I may still be able to tell you more about its origin.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: *Omeluum watches you with cautious intensity. It expects doubt. It expects fear.*

49.text: *Omeluum watches you with cautious intensity. It expects doubt. It expects fear.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Omeluum watches you with cautious intensity. It expects doubt. It expects fear.*

162.speaker: Player
162.text: What aren't you telling me? Is this experiment dangerous?

55.speaker: Omeluum
55.text: Only in that you may be a danger to yourself. What the potion may make you see or feel - I cannot determine.

7.speaker: Omeluum
7.text: But unless you are already a step from death, it will not kill you.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I need some time to prepare.

8.speaker: Omeluum
8.text: Of course. Return when you are ready.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Here. I made a potion of those mushrooms. Will this work?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Do you still have that potion? I'm ready.

0.speaker: Omeluum
0.text: Yes. Although it may be a touch cold by now.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I want that ring to protect my mind.

241.speaker: Omeluum
241.text: What shall you offer in exchange?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Is this enough gold for it?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: There's no trusting a mind flayer. Attack.

251.speaker: Omeluum
251.text: I will not reward your hostility. Begone!
